subject: Re: Help,what's wrong with my TDD practice in my daily life?
msgSnippet: ... That s true,That is the simplest work.But I think should refactor when passes all the tests,otherwise, the code will grow worse .The beauty of  code is
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger"<jbrains762@...> wrote:
> This is the greatest lesson I learned from TDD: when the current design
> passes all the tests, then stop writing code. If you believe the design
> is not complex enough, then you should be able to imagine a test that
> creates the need for that complexity. If you can't imagine such a test,
> then the design is already complex enough.


That's true,That is the simplest work.But I think should refactor when
passes all the tests,otherwise, the code
will grow worse .The beauty of code is different from each design.
